definition: to dress up and make up (like an actor)
to disguise oneself as/to dress up/to play (a role)/to put on (an expression)
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
drag queen/female impersonator

sentences.english: Transvestites should be seen as valued members of society.
sentences.chinese: 扮装癖者应该视为社会上有价值的成员。

sentences.english: Everyone enjoys a game of make-believe now and then.
sentences.chinese: 所有人时不时喜欢搞些扮装游戏。

sentences.english: "I Role Play, Therefore I Am" justifies skirt wearing in feminine role players.
sentences.chinese: 为阴柔扮装的人提供了穿裙装的合理性。

sentences.english: The 501st focuses on Star Wars villain costuming.
sentences.chinese: 五零一集中与星球大战的反派扮装。

sentences.english: Half a durable dress-up is according to the science of the skin, the skin epidermis layer for beauty makeup.
sentences.chinese: 半耐久扮装是根据肌肤科学，在肌肤表皮层进行美妆。

definition: (of actors) to make up/to disguise oneself
variant of 裝扮|装扮[zhuang1 ban4]
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to disguise oneself
(of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress
(Chinese opera) to play a role outside of one's specialty/(modern) to play a transvestite role/to masquerade as an opponent
head ornament
to disguise oneself as/to dress up/to play (a role)/to put on (an expression)
garment
attire/clothing
bizarre dress
kabuki
dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
stage costume
heavy makeup and gaudy dress
clown role in opera/clown/buffoon
